C:/home/LearnHVAC/spark/class/room.cc File Reference

This model uses a very simple heat balance approach to determine T(t) given T(t-1) and the heat gains from t-1 to t. TRoom = TRoomP + ( QSENS*dt + UARoom*(TOut-TRoomP)*dt + mAir*cpAir*(TSup-TRoomP) ) / (cRoomAir*1000);. More...

#include "spark.h"
#include <stdio.h>
#include <string.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

Include dependency graph for room.cc:

Detailed Description

This model uses a very simple heat balance approach to determine T(t) given T(t-1) and the heat gains from t-1 to t. TRoom = TRoomP + ( QSENS*dt + UARoom*(TOut-TRoomP)*dt + mAir*cpAir*(TSup-TRoomP) ) / (cRoomAir*1000);.

Interface variables
  • port TSup " Supply air dry bulb temperature " [C];
  • port mAir " Supply dry air mass flow rate " [kg/s];
  • port QSENS " internal and solar sensible heat gains " [kW]; //always >=zero
  • port TRoom " Room temperature INIT=15.0 " [C];
  • port TwRoom "room air wet bulb temperature" [c];
  • port TRoomP "room temperature at previous step" INIT=21.0 [c];
  • port TOut "outside air temperature" [c];
  • port UARoom "UA of the room" [W/C];
  • port cRoomAir "thermal capacitance of the room (air plus furniture)" [kJ/C];
  • port dt "timestep" [s];
Functions
 TRoom, TwRoom = room (TSup,mAir,QSENS, TRoomP, TOut )

History
  • unknown starting point
  • cleaned up and exposed UA and cRoomAir variables, added a dt variable, Brian Coffey, Sept 24, 2008
